{"body": {"name": "DevHub Developer Contributor report by Vadim for 2024-04-01 - 2024-05-03", "summary": "Started work on standartizing errors in near-sdk-rs, created PRs for RFP contract and indexer", "category": "DevDAO Platform", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "frol.near", "description": "I am submitting this contributor report as a contributor led by @frol.near\\\\nThis is my 4th contributor report. You can find my previous report [here](https://near.org/devhub.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=21)\\\\n\\\\n# Project Details and Timeline\\\\nStarted work on standartizing errors in near-sdk-rs, created PRs for RFP contract and indexer\\\\n\\\\n## Week 1, Apr 1 - Apr 7\\\\n[3.5h] - Tuesday - learned how value_return, promise_return and panic_str work in near-sdk, updated [comment](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues/936#issuecomment-2028676479) about error standartization \\\\n[0.5h] - Wednesday - devhub meeting\\\\n[1.5h] - Thursday - figure out how handle_result works\\\\n[2h] - Friday - make function returning result handle result, research on how to check if the type checks if trait is implemented\\\\n[3h] - Saturday - Research on creating a check that method returns result and ContractError trait is implemented for the error type\\\\n\\\\n## Week 2, Apr 8 - Apr 10\\\\n[5h] - Monday - implemented a check that ContractError trait is implemented, added status and data fields, separate handling from handle_result, error handling with status and error fields\\\\n[2h] - Tuesday - worked on ApprovedConditionally\\\\n[6.5h] - Wednesday - created PR on ApprovedConditionally, deployed and created instructions for Megha, weekly devhub meeting, meeting with Ori on RFP feature\\\\n\\\\n## Week 2, Apr 26 - Apr 28\\\\n[7.5h] - Friday - call with Ori, research on RFP feature, call with Megha, estimate work on RFP\\\\n[9h] - Saturday - create prototype for RFP\\\\n[7.5h] - Sunday - create prototype for RFP-proposals and some checks and tests\\\\n\\\\n## Week 3, Apr 29 - May 3\\\\n[7h] - Monday - fixed checks and their tests for RFP timeline, tested migrations, created separate PR for fixing CI, added notifications for rfp, started work on indexers\\\\n[2.5h] - Tue - learned indexers for proposals\\\\n[6.5h] - Wed - Created working indexer for RFPs + meeting\\\\n[8h] - Thu - Created [PR](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-contract/pull/110) for RFPs\\\\n[3h] - Fri - Created [PR](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-proposals-indexer/pull/2) for Indices, changed labels struct after connecting with Megha and redeployed contract, continue [work](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/pull/1165/files)  on standartizing errors - created example project, remove statuses, added promise call\\\\n\\\\n# Budget Breakdown\\\\nTotal hours: 75\\\\nRate: $50/hour\\\\nTotal amount: $3750 USDT", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "polyprogrammist.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "3750", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "labels": []}

{"body": {"name": "Milestone #4 (9-12 months) - Transition Pagoda\\\\u{2019}s Near Explorer to NearBlocks", "summary": "Please find below an update on our current works. In summary, we have diverted slightly from the items on milestone #3 initially listed, primarily due to re-syncing the new indexer and infrastructure improvements. We have successfully launched nearblocks.io on BOS alongside a suite of components for developers to use.", "category": "Tooling & Infrastructure", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "Hello Devhub,\\\\n\\\\nPlease find below an update on our current works. In summary, we have diverted slightly from the items on milestone #3 initially listed, primarily due to re-syncing the new indexer and infrastructure improvements. We have successfully launched nearblocks.io on BOS alongside a suite of components for developers to use. \\\\n\\\\n**As a reminder : **\\\\n\\\\n- Milestone #1 can be found [here](https://near.social/devgovgigs.near/widget/gigs-board.pages.Post?id=635) ; \\\\n- Milestone #2 can be found [here](https://near.social/devgovgigs.near/widget/gigs-board.pages.Post?id=2042) ;\\\\n- Milestone #3 can be found [here](https://near.social/devgovgigs.near/widget/gigs-board.pages.Post?id=2804).\\\\n\\\\n## Highlights of milestone #1 (month 0-3)\\\\n\\\\n- Launch of the explorer selector on BOS ([link](https://explorer.near.org/)).\\\\n- Nearblocks is now open-source ([link](https://github.com/Nearblocks/nearblocks/)).\\\\n- As well as fixing outdated bugs, re-indexing missing tokens and infrastructure upgrades.\\\\n\\\\nOur public roadmap for milestone #1 can be [found here](https://github.com/orgs/Nearblocks/projects/2/views/2?filterQuery=iteration%3A%22Iteration+1%22+).\\\\n\\\\n## Highlights of milestone #2 (month 3-6)\\\\n\\\\nThe bulk of the work within these 3 months has been on BOS and our new infrastructure. The rewrite on BOS and updated indexer we have coded V3 - which we aim to publish by the end of January / early February 2024. \\\\n\\\\nFollowing the incident caused by the NEAT inscription our focus shifted to our infrastructure. The incident highlighted a bottleneck issue, which we were able to fix and sustain subsequent inscriptions without any impact to the site availability.\\\\n\\\\nOur V3 infrastructure has been focused on building a full high availability design with disaster recovery backup in place. With this new infrastructure in place we are able to tolerate 1 location to be unavailable, at any point in time and continue to operate without any interruption to the end user experience. Our focus for this milestone has been on failover testing and ensuring our code can withstand outages while maintaining the data integrity required of being the near block explorer. For some context, our total in use storage sits at 50TB (inclusive of replicas and disaster recovery). The increased investment in our infrastructure cost we believe is critical to maintain the uptime of Nearblocks.\\\\n\\\\nWe will continue to focus on this high availability, our plans will be to have a gateway and BOS selector on Nearblocks, so users can select between: \\\\n\\\\nNearblocks on BOS Mainnet\\\\nNearblocks on BOS Testnet \\\\nLegacy React app (which will receive only minor updates). \\\\n\\\\nThe following points are completed and will be published in V3: \\\\n\\\\n- Remaining actions from milestone #1 : Can be [seen here](https://github.com/orgs/Nearblocks/projects/2/views/2?filterQuery=iteration%3A%22Iteration+1%22+) in \\\\u{201c}Done\\\\u{201d} ;\\\\n- Updated indexer: Running on mainnet and testnet ([link](https://beta.nearblocks.io/)) ;\\\\n- BOS : Publication of BOS components ([link](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=profile&accountId=nearblocks.near) or search for nearblocks.near [here](https://near.social/lord1.near/widget/component-total)) ; \\\\n- Validators : Validator section in review ([link](https://beta.nearblocks.io/node-explorer)) ;\\\\n- Tokens : Additional legacy tokens added ([link](https://github.com/Nearblocks/nearblocks/issues/15)); \\\\n- Ads: As per request from the ecosystem, we have prepared an ad network for NEAR projects to advertise on Nearblocks. While we know that no one likes ads, the ad revenue will go towards covering the ongoing increased infrastructure costs, and we hope also support Near ecosystem players\\\\n- Contract connect methods updated to use MNW. Wallet selector will be added to BOS version\\\\n\\\\nWe are currently working the following points on V3: \\\\n\\\\n**Tokens:**\\\\n\\\\n- Add SBT token support - Postponed until finalised ([link](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/504))\\\\n- Transaction execution enhancements\\\\n\\\\nOur public roadmap for milestone #2 can be [found here](https://github.com/orgs/Nearblocks/projects/2/views/2). \\\\n\\\\nWe are continuing our attempts to support the ecosystem where best we can, with a number of ongoing requests for additional API data endpoints being worked on for multiple use cases such as taxation, validator stats and wallet support.\\\\n\\\\n## Highlights of milestone #3 (month 6-9) \\\\n\\\\nWithin this milestone we have successfully deployed nearblocks.io on BOS. With this deployment, users can enjoy a faster web experience and developers can leverage a suite of BOS components ([link](https://near.social/mob.near/widget/ProfilePage?accountId=nearblocksonbos.near) - check Widgets tab) we have made available.\\\\n\\\\n**Other feature requests and improvements done within this milestone : **\\\\n- Contract interactions with embedded ABI ;\\\\n- Near.social comments section on addresses, transactions and token pages;\\\\n- Wallet selector integration for contract interactions ;\\\\n- Additional API endpoints for API users (balance history) ;\\\\n- Dark mode ;\\\\n- A new way of visualising a transaction execution plan ([link](https://nearblocks.io/txns/9gQFCZZN2EzjssZkRVZBmgiYjHqfwSAgwX2D62sUhnhP?tab=execution)) ;\\\\nFT & NFT holder count in real-time ;\\\\n- Validator explorer ([link](https://nearblocks.io/node-explorer)).\\\\n- Our public roadmap for milestone #3 can be [found here](https://github.com/orgs/Nearblocks/projects/2/views/3).\\\\n\\\\n## Milestone #4 goals (month 9-12)\\\\n\\\\nNearblocks schema and infrastructure was updated over the past 3 months. A number of breaking changes were forced to be introduced to the API has resulted in significant speed improvements. \\\\n\\\\nWe are continuing to explore data partitioning and compression to be able to scale. For the upcoming milestone will we be focusing on new features, including : \\\\n\\\\n**A light version of the nearblocks explorer.** This will be hosted on BOS and use data backed fully by RPC nodes. The goal will be to offer an alternative data source should NEAR Lake fall out of sync. Users will be able to select the RPC nodes they use for speed and/or uptime ; \\\\n**DEX Analytics.** We will be adding more analytics on trades, token prices, charts and liquidity pairs ;\\\\n**Aurora integration.** Initial discussions around integrating Aurora transactions within the nearblocks.io UI ; \\\\n**Token publishing section.** Integrating near.social feed on token pages ; \\\\n**Remaining milestone #3 items.** Associated contracts, contract verification, contract analytics.\\\\n\\\\nOur public roadmap for milestone #4 can be [found here](https://github.com/orgs/Nearblocks/projects/2/views/4).\\\\n\\\\nWe highly appreciate Devhub\\\\u{2019}s support and are committed to continuing the nearblocks journey!\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "nearblocks_io.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "75000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "NEAR"}, "labels": []}

{"body": {"name": "Optimised NEAR RPC for Enterprises, Startups & Public", "summary": "Seracle has partnered with Oracle.com to facilitate one-click deployment of optimized, enterprise-grade NEAR RPC on Oracle.com. Check out the complete demo here: https://youtu.be/zsOZ1ADm-iM", "category": "Tooling & Infrastructure", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "**Milestone1:** Partnership with Oracle.com, to be a part of the innovative partner network and list NEAR on Oracle Marketplace.\\\\nRefer: https://partner-finder.oracle.com/catalog/Partner/SCPP-SERACLE.\\\\nTimeline: 2 months, including back and forth for partnership due diligence and approval.\\\\n**Requested Milestone grant: $18,544\\\\nStatus: Completed**\\\\nBreakdown:\\\\nOracle billing: $544\\\\nSeracle costs: $18,000 worth of technical and human resources to pitch, follow up, and get approved by Oracle.\\\\n\\\\n**Milestone2:** Build litenode architecture & integrate with Oracle.com\\\\nDevelop litenode architecture using Terraform that enables quicker deployment and low maintenance of RPC nodes in a couple of clicks from Oracle\\\\\\'s marketplace.\\\\nRefer: https://cloudmarketplace.oracle.com/marketplace/en_US/listing/162099600?_afrLoop=526715820468777&_afrWindowMode=2&Adf-Window-Id=w1b31icxkpu&_afrFS=16&_afrMT=screen&_afrMFW=1792&_afrMFH=889&_afrMFDW=1792&_afrMFDH=1120&_afrMFC=8&_afrMFCI=0&_afrMFM=0&_afrMFR=192&_afrMFG=0&_afrMFS=0&_afrMFO=0\\\\nTimeline: 6 months, including rework on Terraform, multiple architecture changes to enable auto-deployment of NEAR RPC node in a couple of clicks.\\\\n**Status: Completed\\\\nRequested Milestone grant: $101,800**\\\\nBreakdown:\\\\nOracle billing: $76,800 for 2 years of pre-sync RPC node hosting, where average monthly billing is $3,200.\\\\nAlready 6 months worth of billing paid/outstanding to be paid by Seracle.\\\\nSeracle billing: $65,000 includes technical resources for 6 months to develop on Terraform, discussions with Oracle team, and rework on architecture to comply with integration requirements. Several email and Slack chat proofs can be provided.\\\\n\\\\n**Milestone3:** Public RPC endpoint provided by Seracle and hosted on Oracle.\\\\nHost, maintain RPC node of NEAR and also provide API layer on NEAR blockchain operations enabling access to a larger group of developers. Additionally, a Postman-like sandbox to test NEAR blockchain APIs.\\\\nRefer:\\\\nPublic RPC: https://api.seracle.com/saas/baas/rpc/near/mainnet/public/\\\\nAPI Docs: https://docs.seracle.com/near/experimental/experimental-changes-all-account-changes\\\\nNEAR sandbox: https://www.seracle.com/chains/near\\\\n**Status: Completed\\\\nRequested Milestone grant: $67,200**\\\\nOracle billing: $19,200 for 2 years of public RPC hosting with an average of $800 per month.\\\\nSeracle billing: $48,000, 6 months development of public RPC NEAR infra, APIs, and sandbox.\\\\n\\\\n**Milestone4**: Content and publish a blog on Oracle.com & press release\\\\nNear Blockchain integration with Oracle.com facilitated by Seracle blog on Oracle.com and press releases with quotes from Oracle.com executive. Content creator already working on video, articles, press releases, and you can refer: https://youtu.be/zsOZ1ADm-iM\\\\n**Status: In progress\\\\nRequested Milestone grant: $25,000,** includes a couple of major press releases and covers legal costs if any.", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "65cbe64bd243dc9ad2a4028e865a55b09bc8417d81f694b9bee605b23cbd4e38", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "212544", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": []}
